title: Lost my starting tabs after creating an account
content: I got a new computer and created a login to copy all my browser info from old to new. Worked great until I went back to the old computer and realized all my tabs set to open had been forgotten. Closed and opened the browser a couple of times trying things before I discovered you can set it to reopen the tabs from last time (which was 3 times ago). I guess I'm screwed but what I thought was an easy copy turned into a headache.
creator: wibatman

title: Tab groups not working
content:
So when i first updated to 137.0 tab groups were working fine, then one day i couldn't create any more. I had a previous tab group, but when i deleted it, there was no way to make another. I tried dragging tabs on top of each other, tried right clicking a tab to "Add Tab to New Group" but there wasn't an option. I updated to 137.0.1 to see if that would fix it, and it didn't. I then tried to uninstall and reinstall still no. I turned my computer off and then on again and also no.

I'd really appreciate any help with this because i'm kinda tearing my hair out trying to find out what changed.
creator: wolfdude1111

title: Very slow to load websites. Sometimes not at all.
content:
Hello! I am working on a brand new computer (i7 14700F, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 Super, 32GB DDR5) with a brand new install of Firefox and sometimes it just won't load certain pages without me stopping it, refreshing, and then (most of the time) it all pops in. Browsing the web works perfectly in Edge, but in Firefox it has been a struggle. Some sites, like Discord, load VERY slowly and most of the time I need to force a refresh via shift and hitting refresh. Discord will take so long to load any image that I see it as a colorful blur before the photo fully loads in for view.

I'm running the most recent version of Windows 11, Firefox v137.0.1 (also had this issue with v137).

I have tried things in Troubleshoot Mode and didn't make a difference. I uninstalled Firefox, removed the %APPDATA%\Mozilla\ folder, and reinstalled but no change. What I haven't tried is Refresh Firefox, but that's because since Troubleshoot Mode didn't make a difference it's a bit hard to imagine Refresh Firefox will -- but if people think it's worth trying I certainly will give it a go!

I've been a FF user for as long as I can remember and I really don't want to give it up so hopefully someone can help me figure out what's going on here because I am currently at a loss and it's a big bummer.

Thanks in advance for the help!
creator: stands.forgotten

title: everything in Firefox account were gone
content: I had the same Firefox account before, and after I re-downloaded Firefox and logged in, my bookmarks and passwords that I had previously synchronized with my Firefox account were gone. I logged into this account and it was even recognized as a newly created account, what is going on?
creator: josiewyy

title: New Firefox (v137.0) Connection Times Out
content: Launching the new Firefox v137.00, it stalls for a long time, then I get the 'The connection has timed out' error. When I look into the Settings I notice in the Startup that both options available are greyed out. Under that that notice 'Firefox is currently your default browser' is displayed normally. So far I have done the following; re-installed v137.00, restarted with my antivirus & VPN (BitDefender)both on & off with no success. It thens drops an error file crash report but I have no idea what all that code means. Any ideas out there? Thanx In Advance!
creator: 55boitoi55

title: Program not working properly
content: My PC is old, uses Windows 7, and I have been using Ancestry.com successfully until recently. It opens properly on my Laptop, but not my PC where the majority of photos and documents are currently stored. Is there something I am doing wrong? I am not super tech savvy and one suggestion was to "allow Ancestry" but I have no clue how to do that.
